TopicTitle: I must end flight in space

Articles.Content:
I have a big, too big, really big ship in orbit. Its such a big ship that i cant rotate it I must end flight and i am playing 0.21:[ Is there a mod for end flight in 0.21? Please help.

Edit:

I SOLVED PROBLEM!

how: just opened "persisent" named file from my save file, opened it with a notepad. Find my vessel with CTRL+F, and i changed status with landed at KSC! And then i recovered the vessel from Space Center. Thanks to all helpers.

That's what he's saying. The end flight option was removed by popular demand due to people accidentally ending their space station mission. Now you have to go to the tracking station at the space center and select "Recover Ship" to end a flight.

Either send a rescue ship or two to get them home or go to the tracking station and blow them up. You can use 'revert to' but only from the initial launch from Kerbin. If you dock with anything or go to the space centre you can only terminate or recover the vessel provided it's on Kerbin.

than that's your own problem. end flight in .20 didn't save what kerbalnauts you have and neither does .21, you'll just have to either end the flight or launch a rescue mission. I believe eventually kerbalnauts that have died will eventually reappear in your roster, but it will take longer than orange suits do to come back.

You could EVA the Kerbals and then go to the space center to end it.

How can i go to the space center when a kerbal is on EVA?

Sounds to me like a rescue mission is in order! Since it's in orbit, it shouldn't be too hard to build a custom-made recovery vehicle - thinking 3 man pod + hitchhiker, with just 1 pilot (leaves 6 spaces for the guys). Just throw it up, get it close, EVA them over and then de-orbit. You can then terminate the original flight in the tracking station.

Sometimes the call has to be made, but if it isn't difficult to recover the Kerbals, I would say rescue them, but if the difficulty is there, it could provide for some new learning experiences, or I would say terminate it from the tracking station.

Yes, I'd go with a rescue mission. And while you are at it, try to alter its orbit, so the ship reenters the atmosphere - and don't forget to make pictures of the reentry!

my guess would be you left and went to the space center or perhaps docked you vehicle together in stages in space? Revert flight is only an option if your flight has been uninterrupted from launch.

I kind of like it this way because it means we have room to experiment without killing kerbals refining our design, but if you wish to assemble a larger ship or space station we need to plan better and know that it will be efficient before you even launch the first piece. Unfortunately the best way to do this is design the entire thing and save it in sections with subassembly manager which isn't possible in the stock game.

Rescue mission for the win. I just had to do that last night. I had sent 3 brave souls to the Mun and my dV budget ended up being to light. They got there, got down to plant a flag and whatnot and it turned out they only had enough dV to get back into a 30km orbit. Not enough to get back to Kerbin.

You know what I think? WE NEED END FLIGHT BACK. Seriously, the new system is even worse.
